programme.title: Stuart Little
Stuart Little
programme.desc:
Stuart Little: Directed by Rob Minkoff. With Michael J. Fox, Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, Jonathan Lipnicki. The Little family adopt a charming young mouse named Stuart, but the family cat wants rid of him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0164912/","name":"Stuart Little","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJlZWZiODItMGE3NC00Yzg3LWFhYTYtZTI2YWNlNjExMDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Little family adopt a charming young mouse named Stuart, but the family cat wants rid of him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0164912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheUnknown837-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"great family film with a good heart","reviewBody":"Both "Stuart Little" and its first sequel, titled "Stuart Little 2" are two nice little family films that I recommend for their effective blend of drama, adult humor that never goes out of hand, controlled suspense and violence as well as language, and yet it never gets so immature as to become only for the kids. Some critics thought that the movie might have had some moments too intense or unsuited for young children. I was eight years old when I first saw this film and it never bothered me. I was surprised to find swearing in this film, but again, it didn't degrade the film because it was sparingly used and by that I mean it was only used once or twice.

The character of Stuart is very effectively brought onto the screen. The mouse is entirely computer-generated in an efficient way and the contributions of Michael J. Fox's voice work out very well. The same goes for the other animated characters. All of the live-action performances were well-done and they blended in perfectly with the CGI characters.

"Stuart Little" has a good heart and it is can be a very warm little family movie for everybody to enjoy. I still enjoy it nine years after I first saw the film and I do recommend it. It's a film that will suit audience members of all ages. As long as you enjoy family films.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130441,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2000-03-15","keywords":"alley cat,cat actor,boat,boy,scene during end credits","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stuart Little","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4253417753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU1ODBiZGQtNzRkNy00ODRhLWI2ZjktMjZiZWI0YjYzOWRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU1ODBiZGQtNzRkNy00ODRhLWI2ZjktMjZiZWI0YjYzOWRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000150/","name":"Michael J. programme.title: Stuart Little 2
Stuart Little 2
programme.desc:
Stuart Little 2: Directed by Rob Minkoff. With Michael J. Fox, Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, Jonathan Lipnicki. Stuart and Snowbell set out across town to rescue a friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0243585/","name":"Stuart Little 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyNDg0Njc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDc3NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Stuart and Snowbell set out across town to rescue a friend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0243585/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A parable on drifting siblings","reviewBody":"Stuart Little 2 is one of those children's films that appeals to both the children and those who must pay the ticket price. I thought those kinds of films only existed with the name "Pixar" stamped on them or the occasional "Dreamworks." The film largely compiles odds and ends from the first film to try and lift the sequel off its feet but its sweet, good-natured charisma and kinetic warmth make the seventy-eight minute endeavor worth it.

The "Little" family are still happy, vibrant, and warm in their quest to give their new mouse sibling, Stuart (voiced by Michael J. Fox) a home he can be proud of. Yet the mother (Geena Davis) still worries that Stuart's small stature gives him the unfair advantage in sports and life itself, while the father (Hugh Laurie) is more of an optimist and feels that if a Little applies himself, he can be quite the character.

The main themes Stuart Little 2 tries to explore, however, are not about doing anything you want to do and proving that being small isn't a limitation but a welcomed challenge, like the first film, but more about siblings that drift away from each other. Stuart's older brother, George (Jonathan Lipnicki) is beginning to spend more time with his friends rather than Stuart, and while this is a natural part of life, it is nonetheless heartbreaking to the mouse himself, who begins to view himself as just a pest (no pun intended).

Stuart begins to befriend a small yellow canary named Margalo (Melanie Griffith), who he rescued after seeing her being pursued by an ominous falcon in the sky. It turns out, Margalo is in cahoots with the falcon to steal valuables from homes all across New York City, but little Margalo keeps that secret away from Stuart when she discovers how kind and gentle he really is.

Stuart Little 2 isn't particularly compelling or a very life-affirming film, but it's a genial, warm picture, with great computer effects, wonderful yet subtle themes on sibling relationships, and a plethora of jokes that kids and adults will find pleasing and joyful.

Starring: Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, and Jonathan Lipnicki. Voiced by: Michael J. Fox, Melanie Griffith, and Nathan Lane. Directed by: Rob Minkoff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52642,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-09-04","keywords":"live action cgi hybrid,animal character name as title,stuart little character,man wears eyeglasses,boy wears eyeglasses","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stuart Little 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4035313945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFiZTk0NzQtNWE4Ny00Mzk4LWFhZDYtMzBlMTk2YWI2MDIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFiZTk0NzQtNWE4Ny00Mzk4LWFhZDYtMzBlMTk2YWI2MDIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000150/","name":"Michael J. I thought those kinds of films only existed with the name "Pixar" stamped on them or the occasional "Dreamworks." The film largely compiles odds and ends from the first film to try and lift the sequel off its feet but its sweet, good-natured charisma and kinetic warmth make the seventy-eight minute endeavor worth it.

The "Little" family are still happy, vibrant, and warm in their quest to give their new mouse sibling, Stuart (voiced by Michael J. Fox) a home he can be proud of. Yet the mother (Geena Davis) still worries that Stuart's small stature gives him the unfair advantage in sports and life itself, while the father (Hugh Laurie) is more of an optimist and feels that if a Little applies himself, he can be quite the character.

The main themes Stuart Little 2 tries to explore, however, are not about doing anything you want to do and proving that being small isn't a limitation but a welcomed challenge, like the first film, but more about siblings that drift away from each other. Stuart's older brother, George (Jonathan Lipnicki) is beginning to spend more time with his friends rather than Stuart, and while this is a natural part of life, it is nonetheless heartbreaking to the mouse himself, who begins to view himself as just a pest (no pun intended).

Stuart begins to befriend a small yellow canary named Margalo (Melanie Griffith), who he rescued after seeing her being pursued by an ominous falcon in the sky. It turns out, Margalo is in cahoots with the falcon to steal valuables from homes all across New York City, but little Margalo keeps that secret away from Stuart when she discovers how kind and gentle he really is.

Stuart Little 2 isn't particularly compelling or a very life-affirming film, but it's a genial, warm picture, with great computer effects, wonderful yet subtle themes on sibling relationships, and a plethora of jokes that kids and adults will find pleasing and joyful.

Starring: Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, and Jonathan Lipnicki. Voiced by: Michael J. Fox, Melanie Griffith, and Nathan Lane. A teacher knows she is being bullied and does nothing about it. Her parents are complete idiots who have to go to her brother to try and get information about why their daughter is upset. Her brother is literally the only one who picks up on the fact she's being bullied even though she's bullied right in front of her parents or teachers.\n\nThis movie basically teaches kids they can't go to adults to help or that adults won't help and that they have to solve the problems themselves. Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098635/","name":"When Harry Met Sally...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0ODEwNjM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjU2Mzg3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098635/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PyrolyticCarbon"},"dateCreated":"2002-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful film, giving hope to all those seemingly unrequited loves.","reviewBody":"Can you beat some of the lines in this film? As a guy, which I am, I identified with Harry's lines so much, and you can't help but side with him. The chemistry between the two actors, Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan is superb, and you believe in them when they talk, you feel for them when they look at each other. Even the friends are well casted, Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby. It's such relaxed acting and filming that you do nothing but watch these people fall in love, and pretty soon you feel like you're involved as well. With a fantastic soundtrack, direction, script and acting, it's a great film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":207102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-07-21","keywords":"male female friendship,opposites attract,fake orgasm,new york,pessimist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi129743385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000345/","name":"Billy Crystal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000402/","name":"Carrie Fisher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
Schlaflos in Seattle
programme.desc: Sleepless in Seattle: Directed by Nora Ephron. With Tom Hanks, Ross Malinger, Rita Wilson, Victor Garber. A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108160/","name":"Sleepless in Seattle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY1MDJkZGUtZTE2OS00ODZiLTlmNzQtMDZjNzM2ZjkwM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rebochan"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"It succeeds at what it sets out to do","reviewBody":"I won't lie to you-this movie is a CHICK FLICK! Though I never saw it with a guy, it is definitely a chick flick. That said, it's a high-end chick flick, which probably a few guys might enjoy, unless they happen to be the exploding helicopter type^^; This movie feels more like a modern day adaptation of the classic romance "An Affair To Remember," and it keeps referencing it too (In fact, the Cary Grant classic is very integral to the plot). Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan have great chemistry together, and they both do what they're good at-Tom Hanks portraying the Everyman, and Meg Ryan being cute and innocent. I have to disagree with an earlier comment that this film is unfair to guys-the way the characters are portrayed, I'd have to say that in the reverse situation, I'd still feel the same way. Meg Ryan does not have the "evil woman" syndrome that popped up in later 90's chick flicks (The most notorious of which was "My Best Friend's Wedding"). She is very believable and actually does care about the feelings of her fiance. What I particularly liked is that the fiance was not portrayed as someone who Meg would do well to leave. Most movies fall into this trap-Someone is about to marry someone who is horrible and find that someone else is better, the viewer supposedly not feeling bad because the fiance was a jerk anyway. Tom Hanks really shines here as someone who has lost the most important person in his life and is trying to rebuild again. He always has a knack for easily slipping into the roles he's given and making them really convincing. He does not fail here-you feel for him especially during the sequences where he starts remembering his late wife. The movie's plot starts to stretch plausibility at the end, but not to the point where it destroys the entire film. The ending scene in particular is handled very carefully. You could have had a big, romantic, tear-jerking moment. Instead, the movie takes a more simplistic approach, and it succeeds-it feels much more natural than the alternative. Overall, if you're in for a feel good romance, you should see this. If you happen to be female, this is DEFINITELY worth watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-06-25","keywords":"radio show,seattle washington,colleague,diner,waitress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi727367449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539678/","name":"Ross Malinger"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0033578/","name":"Jeff Arch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. IMDb data; ttnr: 0108160, Title: Sleepless in Seattle, --- Description: Sleepless in Seattle: Directed by Nora Ephron. With Tom Hanks, Ross Malinger, Rita Wilson, Victor Garber. A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108160/","name":"Sleepless in Seattle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY1MDJkZGUtZTE2OS00ODZiLTlmNzQtMDZjNzM2ZjkwM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108160/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Rebochan","dateCreated":"2001-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"It succeeds at what it sets out to do","reviewBody":"I won't lie to you-this movie is a CHICK FLICK! Though I never saw it with a guy, it is definitely a chick flick. That said, it's a high-end chick flick, which probably a few guys might enjoy, unless they happen to be the exploding helicopter type^^; This movie feels more like a modern day adaptation of the classic romance "An Affair To Remember," and it keeps referencing it too (In fact, the Cary Grant classic is very integral to the plot). Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan have great chemistry together, and they both do what they're good at-Tom Hanks portraying the Everyman, and Meg Ryan being cute and innocent. I have to disagree with an earlier comment that this film is unfair to guys-the way the characters are portrayed, I'd have to say that in the reverse situation, I'd still feel the same way. Meg Ryan does not have the "evil woman" syndrome that popped up in later 90's chick flicks (The most notorious of which was "My Best Friend's Wedding"). She is very believable and actually does care about the feelings of her fiance. What I particularly liked is that the fiance was not portrayed as someone who Meg would do well to leave. Most movies fall into this trap-Someone is about to marry someone who is horrible and find that someone else is better, the viewer supposedly not feeling bad because the fiance was a jerk anyway. Tom Hanks really shines here as someone who has lost the most important person in his life and is trying to rebuild again. He always has a knack for easily slipping into the roles he's given and making them really convincing. He does not fail here-you feel for him especially during the sequences where he starts remembering his late wife. The movie's plot starts to stretch plausibility at the end, but not to the point where it destroys the entire film. The ending scene in particular is handled very carefully. You could have had a big, romantic, tear-jerking moment. Instead, the movie takes a more simplistic approach, and it succeeds-it feels much more natural than the alternative. Overall, if you're in for a feel good romance, you should see this. If you happen to be female, this is DEFINITELY worth watching.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-06-25","keywords":"radio show,seattle washington,colleague,diner,waitress","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi727367449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539678/","name":"Ross Malinger"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0033578/","name":"Jeff Arch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc:
Sherlock Holmes: Directed by Guy Ritchie. With Robert Downey Jr., Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong. Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0988045/","name":"Sherlock Holmes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NjEwNjUxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzk0MjQ5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0988045/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"superflysamurai13"},"dateCreated":"2009-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"'Sherlock Holmes' is a Fast-Paced Whirlwind Adventure","reviewBody":"-----It came as a surprise when Guy Ritchie was chosen as the Director of 'Sherlock Holmes.' Known primarily for his work on indie crime films, such as 'Snatch' or last year's 'RocknRolla,' Ritchie had never taken on a mainstream franchise film, the likes of which 'Sherlock Holmes' promised to be. Thankfully, Ritchie was able to mesh the two genres on some level, with his trademark style of film-making ever present in his latest outing. The result is a film that will surely prove the most popular take on the character outside of Conan Doyle's original novels, and will also likely spawn a franchise.

-----Sherlock Holmes and his partner Dr. Watson have been successfully solving cases throughout England for years. Their most recent case was that of Lord Blackwood, a man who murdered in the name of his black magic. Finally hanged for his crimes, it comes as an unpleasant surprise when he literally rises from his grave. And so it is up to Holmes and Watson to find him and stop him before his killing spree devours the whole of England.

-----Robert Downey Jr. is right at home in the role of the infamous detective. Swapping out futuristic armor for a pipe and fiddle, he plays another character with the wit and confidence of his Tony Stark persona in 'Iron Man.' This makes sense because, to some degree, what is 'Sherlock Holmes' if not merely the Tony Stark character set back about a hundred years? Regardless, Downey Jr. is excellent, providing an effervescent wit and supreme charm to his latest role. Jude Law plays his right hand man, Dr. John Watson, in a role much smarter than past incarnations of the Watson character. The two are more equals than hero and sidekick, and their chemistry is indelible. Even when the narrative becomes a bit erratic, the pleasure of seeing the two stars' continuous verbal quarrels is worth the price of admission alone. Together they inspire numerous laughs and clever rebuttals to an unrelenting degree, allowing many of the jokes to pass unrealized, saved for the treat of a second viewing.

-----'Sherlock Holmes' has a method completely reminiscent of Director Guy Ritchie's earlier films. In the style of show first-explain later, Ritchie has effectively applied his trademark fast cuts to the mind of his lead protagonist. Much as Watson is often catching up to Holmes' various schemes, so must the audience sit in question for a large portion of the film, waiting for Holmes to reveal his motivations. Particularly similar to his work on last year's entertaining 'RocknRolla,' along with many of his other films, Ritchie takes the first hour of his endeavors laying out the dots to be connected in his lengthy but fast-paced crescendo throughout the second half of the film. With 'Holmes,' he has compromised nothing, rather managed to find a better balance between build up and climax. With various fistfight intervals dissecting the chaotic mystery, Ritchie keeps the audience entertained even when they're unsure about the direction of the plot. That being said, many viewers will begin to question their purchase throughout the films first half hour, as the story puzzles more than entertains. But rest assured, a satisfying finale follows, with so many pieces coming together that a second viewing is a necessity to begin dissecting the intricacies of the case being solved, if that only means better understanding Holmes' course of action.

-----Visually Ritchie has constructed a film in the shadows, only occasionally getting out into spanning shots of daylight England. This, like the rest of the film, settles into place as the film develops. His infamous lightning cuts allow no slow moments, even when the pace would typically meander in the hands of a lesser Director. Holmes also riddles off explanations so rapidly that audiences can hardly pick up on all of what he is saying, or all of the nuanced humor during the interplay between Watson and him. Unfortunately much of the laugh-out-loud humor as been divulged in the trailer, but a film should not be penalized for the faults of its advertising campaign. The musical score is supplemental to the frantic convolutions of the film's earlier scenes, providing a spirited tune that rides the energy of fiddling and poses as anything but generic. The locations are likewise smart, the costumes are admirable, and the effects are gritty, proving to be another benefit of having an indie Director helm an event film. Ultimately there are no blatant shortcuts in the way of computer generation, only clever sets and a brilliant Art Direction.

-----'Sherlock Holmes' is refreshingly less conventional than one might guess, even if some viewers may find themselves a bit lost by Ritchie's unforgiving cuts and unrelenting energy. It jumps right into the tale, no origins told and no flashbacks necessary, relying on Holmes renowned history. Furthermore, many subtle elements of the various characters' past interactions are left for the audience to deduce in the fashion of Sherlock Holmes himself. And while the film may not be the grand epic some may have hoped for, its sheer entertainment value is undeniable. From the moment the credits roll it's apparent that 'Sherlock Holmes' cannot be full appreciated in one screening, and will likely grow in favor upon further viewings. It further presents itself as a gem of home entertainment in the long run, as a film that can be enjoyed on any occasion in any company, even with its hefty two-hour-plus runtime. This is a byproduct of the wonderfully gritty action Ritchie brings to the tale, and the uncompromising portrayal of the classic characters by the films superb leads. 'Sherlock Holmes' won't be quite what you expect, and you may even be dismayed by the films feisty narrative style, but more often than not you'll be completely entertained by the characters on screen in this fun addition to the loaded Holiday season.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":606709,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2009-12-30","keywords":"sherlock holmes character,scotland yard inspector,baker street london,belt,serial killer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sherlock Holmes -- Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi781780249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3NDQ5MTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0ODY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3NDQ5MTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQ0ODY5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Detective Sherlock Holmes (Downey Jr.) and his stalwart partner Watson (Law) engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1046097/","name":"Rachel McAdams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3467335/","name":"Michael Robert Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0669756/","name":"Anthony Peckham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1334526/","name":"Simon Kinberg"}],"duration":"PT2H8M"}</script><metacontent="

Instead, he embarks upon a campaign of revenge against his former boss and begins to renovate a roller-coaster with an old scho","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5376196/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thomas-leitha"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"What's boring on stage gets awful on the screen","reviewBody":"You get the basic setting of the plot after 20 minutes and even if the story tries to surprise you it is predictable. programme.title: Sahara
Sahara – Abenteuer in der Wüste
programme.desc: Sahara: Directed by Breck Eisner. With Jude Akuwudike, Mark Aspinall, Rakie Ayola, Christopher Bello. Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0318649/","name":"Sahara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExOTM4NDUzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTgzNzczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318649/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"buiger"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pure escapism... but what's wrong with that?","reviewBody":"This movie is definitely not a masterpiece. The screenplay is dumb. The acting is to say the least, average. The story is preposterous. Yet, as Ebert nicely put it, "I enjoyed this movie on its own dumb level, which must mean (I am forced to conclude) in my own dumb way". Yes, this is a film you should watch with your brain switched comfortably to the 'Off' position, a nice cold beer on the table and a bag of popcorn in your lap. When you come to think about it though, isn't that what movies are supposed to be all about in the first place?\n\nP.S. One thing worth mention though is the excellent cinematography. The movie is a wonderful African picture book, which definitely helps the overall experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-04-20","keywords":"beach,evil man,good versus evil,bare chested male,disguise","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sahara","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2089091353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001872/","name":"Steve Zahn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252135/","name":"Breck Eisner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129170/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0145519/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193774/","name":"Clive Cussler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232776/","name":"Thomas Dean Donnelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649191/","name":"Joshua Oppenheimer"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trainwreck
Dating Queen
programme.desc: Trainwreck: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Colin Quinn, Devin Fabry, Carla Oudin, Amy Schumer. Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3152624/","name":"Trainwreck","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MjgwNTMyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc1MjI0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3152624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thedivinewingsoftragedy"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"How this was nominated for a golden globe is beyond me","reviewBody":"This was unoriginal and only saved by the characters that are actually funny people in real life. Written by Amy Schumer, she manages to have the worst character and performance in the film. And herein lies the ultimate irony: the worst performance in this film was also nominated for a golden globe. A collection of clichés and stolen one liners from Sex and the City... a really poor effort that is only worth watching for Bill Hader's performance and the supporting cast. John Cena's and Lebron's performances might be a sort of surprise but anyone who had watched interviews in laid back settings knew they had potential. Adding brilliant comedians to the cast who can ad lib and improvise is a smart move but doesn't add value to Schumer's work. I have been noticing in the last few years an effort to hype Amy and turn her into a sort of new Tina Fey or Amy Poehler, but nominating this disaster for golden globes is a disgrace and steals credibility to the awards.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134158,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2015-08-26","keywords":"funeral,actress playing herself,actress shares first name with character,written by star,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2692067353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzMDI2MjIyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUyMzYwNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzMDI2MjIyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUyMzYwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2154960/","name":"Amy Schumer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352778/","name":"Bill Hader"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488953/","name":"Brie Larson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169264/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2154960/","name":"Amy Schumer"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Knocked Up
Beim ersten Mal
programme.desc: Knocked Up: Directed by Judd Apatow. With Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl, Paul Rudd, Leslie Mann. For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478311/","name":"Knocked Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgzYjMzMWItNDFiYi00ZjhkLWIyMzYtZGRlY2FmNzkwNjRhL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478311/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"essex777"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"awful; avoid being knocked up by a bad film.","reviewBody":"i was very disappointed in this film as reviewers claimed something good and there was none, zero! i cannot think of one positive except it finally ends and magnificent quiet fills the space left by actors swearing, abusing each other, and us. save your money, tell everyone you know to do likewise and see something else. this film is classless, base, stupid, boring, dull, a total waste of time. I rarely have seen a film that was so bad that I felt compelled to post a warning to the general public to run in the opposite direction. I wanted to see it because I'd seen a few of the actors on late night shows and daytime shows where they promoted the sweetness that evolved in the story line. They went on and on with comments about depth. I find this totally hilarious in retrospect as "depth" as a description of the emotional emptiness of the characters in this film would be like someone describing insanity as the highest form of intellectual development. I was hoodwinked and hope you will not be likewise 'knocked up.'"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":360184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-10-31","keywords":"one night stand,unplanned pregnancy,slacker,pregnancy,female nudity","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478311/","name":"Knocked Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgzYjMzMWItNDFiYi00ZjhkLWIyMzYtZGRlY2FmNzkwNjRhL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478311/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"essex777","dateCreated":"2007-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"awful; avoid being knocked up by a bad film.","reviewBody":"i was very disappointed in this film as reviewers claimed something good and there was none, zero! i cannot think of one positive except it finally ends and magnificent quiet fills the space left by actors swearing, abusing each other, and us. save your money, tell everyone you know to do likewise and see something else. this film is classless, base, stupid, boring, dull, a total waste of time. I rarely have seen a film that was so bad that I felt compelled to post a warning to the general public to run in the opposite direction. I wanted to see it because I'd seen a few of the actors on late night shows and daytime shows where they promoted the sweetness that evolved in the story line. They went on and on with comments about depth. I find this totally hilarious in retrospect as "depth" as a description of the emotional emptiness of the characters in this film would be like someone describing insanity as the highest form of intellectual development. I was hoodwinked and hope you will not be likewise 'knocked up.'","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":360184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-10-31","keywords":"one night stand,unplanned pregnancy,slacker,pregnancy,female nudity","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"],"duration":"PT2H9M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fack ju Göhte 3
Fack Ju Göhte 3
programme.desc:
Fack ju Göhte 3: Directed by Bora Dagtekin. With Elyas M'Barek, Katja Riemann, Jella Haase, Sandra Hüller. A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6471264/","name":"Fack ju Göhte 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlkYWJjZDItNzA2OS00ZWZjLTg4NmItNWRjMjJjNTZlODU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank robber becomes a teacher after being released from prison and finds himself at the center of a number of crazy adventures.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6471264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mrpanda-00412"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable, but nowhere as good as the first two movies","reviewBody":"This is the third part of a trilogy and as such the novelty of the scenario is fading. The first movie was surprisingly good and not as expected. The second movie played in an entirely different environment which added a few new elements to the story. Now the third movie's setting is back where it all started: at school.

To me it seemed like the movie does not really know what it wants to do. In the first two movies, the main protagonist (the ex-con teacher) gradually opened up to the children, became friendlier, and started to care for them. This movie reboots the whole thing by making our guy dislike the children at first, only to let him warm up throughout the movie once more. In general the movie seems to re-establish many things for viewers who have not seen the first two movies. The same thing goes for the jokes, which are very similar to the two previous movies, too similar even. Overall I just felt like the two movies never happened and we are seeing more or less the same thing again. Maybe this is why the first half-hour of the movie also seemed a bit like not having a clear purpose at all. The movie wants to establish the situation, but not really. It wants to continue where the predecessors left off, but not really. It throws around jokes that are not new, really.

The second part of the movie gets more interesting and starts following a clearer story-line, albeit in a linear and predictable way. This is not unsurprising for a comedy, but compared to the predecessors it is just not as good.

If you truly enjoyed the first two movies, you will still like this one. If you did not care for the first two movies, this one is definitely not for you. It suffers from exactly the same problems as similar trilogies at the point of the third installment. Take Despicable Me for example. Not a bad movie, just nothing new and no surprises for the viewer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-26","keywords":"singing in a car,female teacher,teacher student relationship,teacher student conflict,munich germany","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153260825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBhZGNlYTctYmYxYi00YmU2LTlhMDItN2E0ZjRjNzU4NmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065929/","name":"Elyas M'Barek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480916/","name":"Bora Dagtekin"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bean
Bean – Der ultimative Katastrophenfilm
programme.desc:
Bean: Directed by Mel Smith. With Rowan Atkinson, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Pamela Reed. The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118689/","name":"Bean","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU2YzY5NDEtM2M3NC00NGM0LTg3MmItNWQ1OWY2ZmNkZTU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118689/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DVD_Connoisseur"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Average but warm-hearted comedy","reviewBody":""Bean" is the average but warm-hearted, large screen adventure of Rowan Atkinson's bumbling but strangely likable character.

With a smörgåsbord of talent behind this film, there are a few genuine laughs but, sadly, they're few and far between. This film could have been so much better in the hands of another director. Mel Smith appears to have been on cruise-control making this movie. It's a case of comedy by numbers and the film never seems to shift gear.

The always amusing Peter MacNicol is excellent as the suffering David Langley and provides the perfect foil to Atkinson's Bean.

An average comedy movie, it's worth a viewing if there's nothing else on the television."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101639,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-08-01","keywords":"mr bean character,california,los angeles california,1990s,surname as title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bean","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1186529561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Gramercy Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001493/","name":"Peter MacNicol"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590055/","name":"John Mills"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809321/","name":"Mel Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103644/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003741/","name":"Robin Driscoll"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre
Asterix und Obelix: Mission Kleopatra
programme.desc: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre: Directed by Alain Chabat. With Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Jamel Debbouze, Monica Bellucci. Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250223/","name":"Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q3NmUzNjAtM2VjMS00MGU3LWE4YjEtZTM1NDM0YTdlOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"they're crazy those Romans!","reviewBody":"In 1995, the movie "le hussard sur le toit" was released and it had a record; it was the most expensive movie ever made. This record was beaten seven years later with this film. But once again, this enormous budget was worth to be spending. Alain Chabat controls perfectly the huge incomes to his disposition (for example, sceneries are carefully restored and the crowd movements are wide) and he succeeds in recreating the fanciful atmosphere of the Astérix'albums. His making is very inventive, full of clever visuals and ringing brainwaves. Moreover, he doesn't only emphasize on the special effects of the movie and this was one of the faults of the first Astérix' film made by Claude Zidi in 1999. On the other hand, what a casting! It's very similar to the Sacha Guitry's film "si Versailles m'étais conté" and you can have fun by guessing which actor epitomize which character of the album "Astérix et Cléopâtre". As far as Christian Clavier and Gérard Depardieu are concerned, they're better managed than in the Zidi's film: they don't ham it up and are more credible in their respective roles even if Depardieu isn't fat enough. The other actors are excellent, (especially Gérard Darmon) rightly chosen even the minor actors in whom Chabat grants a big importance. Nevertheless, this one doesn't fit in the Caesar's role: he is a bit listless and not authoritarian enough. At last, let's notice that the characters' names are successful and funny puns (Menubestofplus, Numérobis, Itinéris), but they're only easily understood for French people. At the end, a successful adaptation of the Astérix's comic strip on the screen and a pleasant entertainment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51219,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

Mr. Deeds
programme.desc:
Mr. Deeds: Directed by Steven Brill. With Adam Sandler, Winona Ryder, John Turturro, Allen Covert. A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0280590/","name":"Mr. Deeds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3NTE3M2QtNWQ0MS00ZmRkLWIwNTMtOTA0ZGM5N2UwMWNjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0280590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjw2305"},"dateCreated":"2007-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty Funny, but Ultimately Average","reviewBody":"Longfellow Deeds (Adam Sandler) is a small town guy who is taken to the big city when he learns he has an inheritance of $40 billion from a long lost uncle. He has to adjust to life in a Palatial Mansion with a personal butler, and he meets a beautiful school nurse (Winona Ryder); but its not long before the money begins to change everything, and he learns things are not what they seem.

This remake is not without plenty of laughs, but it never quite manages to do anything thats truly hilarious or new. For a bit of fun its worth a watch, but it's one of those films that you will forget about pretty quickly.

6/10 its just average i'm afraid","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"unknowing heir,sudden wealth,fish out of water,character name as title,liar revealed","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mr. Deeds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi641967129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Mr. Deeds"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001806/","name":"John Turturro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109359/","name":"Steven Brill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445502/","name":"Clarence Budington Kelland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728307/","name":"Robert Riskin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0379056/","name":"Tim Herlihy"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bean
Bean – Der ultimative Katastrophenfilm
programme.desc:
Bean: Directed by Mel Smith. With Rowan Atkinson, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Pamela Reed. The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118689/","name":"Bean","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU2YzY5NDEtM2M3NC00NGM0LTg3MmItNWQ1OWY2ZmNkZTU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118689/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DVD_Connoisseur"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Average but warm-hearted comedy","reviewBody":""Bean" is the average but warm-hearted, large screen adventure of Rowan Atkinson's bumbling but strangely likable character.

With a smörgåsbord of talent behind this film, there are a few genuine laughs but, sadly, they're few and far between. This film could have been so much better in the hands of another director. Mel Smith appears to have been on cruise-control making this movie. It's a case of comedy by numbers and the film never seems to shift gear.

The always amusing Peter MacNicol is excellent as the suffering David Langley and provides the perfect foil to Atkinson's Bean.

An average comedy movie, it's worth a viewing if there's nothing else on the television."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101639,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-08-01","keywords":"mr bean character,california,los angeles california,1990s,surname as title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bean","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1186529561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Gramercy Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001493/","name":"Peter MacNicol"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590055/","name":"John Mills"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809321/","name":"Mel Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103644/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003741/","name":"Robin Driscoll"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
Hot Tub – Der Whirlpool ... ist 'ne verdammte Zeitmaschine!
programme.desc: Hot Tub Time Machine: Directed by Steve Pink. With John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson, Rob Corddry. A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1231587/","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjExODA4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYwMDYxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1231587/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in time","reviewBody":"Not an instant classic, but a lot of fun to watch. I think you can summarize it like that. The main actors are doing a great job selling the very silly idea of time traveling with or rather inside a hot tub! If you get sucked into that, everything else will work too. But if you don't like that general idea ... Maybe you shouldn't watch the movie after all and save yourself the time (and grief).\n\nIt's hilarious and it has heart, even when it's gross at times. Which it can be, but it's easy to tolerate and forgive it for those little moments, because it actually is funny. Trying to figure out how it actually works (the physics of the time travel) would probably lead into a territory the movie would not want you to go ... and why would you want to ruin your own enjoyment ... if you're having fun watching - stick with it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168749,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2010-03-26","keywords":"bare breasts,ski resort,cheating wife,promiscuous woman,casual sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Tub Time Machine: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1318257689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MjA0MDY4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODA3NjYwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four guys travel back to their respective 80s heydays thanks to a time-bending hot tub."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1117791/","name":"Rob Corddry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0732497/","name":"Craig Robinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684336/","name":"Steve Pink"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079035/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372222/","name":"Josh Heald"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
Die Hexen von Eastwick
programme.desc: The Witches of Eastwick: Directed by George Miller. With Jack Nicholson, Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer. Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094332/","name":"The Witches of Eastwick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4ZGRlNDEtNDliMi00NmI0LThlYjctYmViMjI0MDlmOWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three single women in a picturesque village have their wishes granted, at a cost, when a mysterious and flamboyant man arrives in their lives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"smatysia"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this!","reviewBody":"What fun Nicholson must have had with this! He really hams it up here. Very good supporting work by Cher, Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfieffer, and Veronica Cartwright. The plot is a little bit impenetrable. The "witches" are at first unaware of their power. I suppose I should read Updike's novel, but the one book of his I did read sucked. Anyway, I recommend the film, for it seems a bit different than normal Hollywood formula.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66970,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1987-06-12","keywords":"divorced woman,windstorm,verbose speech,1980s,hand on woman's butt","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Witches of Eastwick","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2046165273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWYzMmFiZDItMTRkYS00ZDZhLTljZDAtZTI4M2Y3NDJlMjBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWYzMmFiZDItMTRkYS00ZDZhLTljZDAtZTI4M2Y3NDJlMjBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Warner Bros. programme.title: Miss Congeniality
Miss Undercover
programme.desc: Miss Congeniality: Directed by Donald Petrie. With Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen. An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0212346/","name":"Miss Congeniality","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhjNzc4N2MtNWE5ZC00N2M4LWFiYjEtMTE5YmYyMTg3OGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0212346/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Special-K88"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"silly material made worthwhile","reviewBody":"Good-natured and funny comedy has Bullock perfectly cast as an uptight, tomboyish federal agent who—for the first time in her entire life—decides to embrace her femininity after she's assigned to go undercover at a beauty pageant to try and apprehend an elusive criminal. She's never even worn a dress, much less makeup and accessories, and the results are hilarious as she tries to do her job and be a credible contestant as well. Film's setup and execution are predictable, yet kept afloat by a meaningful story, good lines, and big time laughs. Bullock is as appealing as she's ever been, and surrounded here by a first-rate supporting cast. ***"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":198450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"beauty contest,fbi federal bureau of investigation,knee high boots,boots,pageant","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Miss Congeniality","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1980671001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Miss Congeniality"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000323/","name":"Michael Caine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000973/","name":"Benjamin Bratt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677953/","name":"Donald Petrie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024939/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0974301/","name":"Katie Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524095/","name":"Caryn Lucas"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Mr. Deeds
programme.desc:
Mr. Deeds: Directed by Steven Brill. With Adam Sandler, Winona Ryder, John Turturro, Allen Covert. A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0280590/","name":"Mr. Deeds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3NTE3M2QtNWQ0MS00ZmRkLWIwNTMtOTA0ZGM5N2UwMWNjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0280590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjw2305"},"dateCreated":"2007-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty Funny, but Ultimately Average","reviewBody":"Longfellow Deeds (Adam Sandler) is a small town guy who is taken to the big city when he learns he has an inheritance of $40 billion from a long lost uncle. He has to adjust to life in a Palatial Mansion with a personal butler, and he meets a beautiful school nurse (Winona Ryder); but its not long before the money begins to change everything, and he learns things are not what they seem.

This remake is not without plenty of laughs, but it never quite manages to do anything thats truly hilarious or new. For a bit of fun its worth a watch, but it's one of those films that you will forget about pretty quickly.

6/10 its just average i'm afraid","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"unknowing heir,sudden wealth,fish out of water,character name as title,liar revealed","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mr. Deeds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi641967129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Mr. Deeds"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001806/","name":"John Turturro"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109359/","name":"Steven Brill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445502/","name":"Clarence Budington Kelland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728307/","name":"Robert Riskin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0379056/","name":"Tim Herlihy"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0280590, Title: Mr. Deeds, --- Description: Mr. Deeds: Directed by Steven Brill. With Adam Sandler, Winona Ryder, John Turturro, Allen Covert. A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0280590/","name":"Mr. Deeds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3NTE3M2QtNWQ0MS00ZmRkLWIwNTMtOTA0ZGM5N2UwMWNjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A sweet-natured, small-town guy inherits a controlling stake in a media conglomerate and begins to do business his way.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0280590/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mjw2305","dateCreated":"2007-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty Funny, but Ultimately Average","reviewBody":"Longfellow Deeds (Adam Sandler) is a small town guy who is taken to the big city when he learns he has an inheritance of $40 billion from a long lost uncle. He has to adjust to life in a Palatial Mansion with a personal butler, and he meets a beautiful school nurse (Winona Ryder); but its not long before the money begins to change everything, and he learns things are not what they seem.

This remake is not without plenty of laughs, but it never quite manages to do anything thats truly hilarious or new. For a bit of fun its worth a watch, but it's one of those films that you will forget about pretty quickly.

6/10 its just average i'm afraid","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140582,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"unknowing heir,sudden wealth,fish out of water,character name as title,liar revealed","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mr. Deeds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi641967129","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzM2E4YjEtNTljNi00ZWI0LTg5YmEtNDEzNDRiNzQ3Y2YzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Mr. Deeds","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001806/","name":"John Turturro"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109359/","name":"Steven Brill"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445502/","name":"Clarence Budington Kelland","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728307/","name":"Robert Riskin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0379056/","name":"Tim Herlihy"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

I absolutely love the humor in this one, it's so stupid, I'm still dying over it every single time - and watched the movie uncountable times. Both main characters are absolutely hilarious. Over the top, but you can easily like them. I didn't like their two other movies "voll normaaal" and especially "die superbullen" very well, but they definitely nailed it with Ballermann 6. If you can get into the snese of humor, you've at least got to like it. programme.title: La Belle Époque
Die Schönste Zeit unseres Lebens
programme.desc: La Belle Époque: Directed by Nicolas Bedos. With Daniel Auteuil, Guillaume Canet, Doria Tillier, Fanny Ardant. A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9172422/","name":"La Belle Époque","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTMzZjA2ZmMtZWMyMS00MWMxLTljYjktMWUzYjE0ZWNiY2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple in crisis. He, disillusioned, sees his life upset the day an entrepreneur offers him to plunge back into the time of his choice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9172422/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DoctorStrabismus"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clever, witty, dream-like, surreal, and excellent","reviewBody":"My own personal 'Belle Époque' would have been my student days in the late 60s, most especially '69, when I fell amazingly in love, so I was 5 years ahead of Victor, but I can so much identify with the nostalgia, and the desire to go back. Indeed, I often visit those days in my dreams, with the sort of distortion of events that only dreams can do. So if I could pay to be magically transformed completely to 1969, to live its fabulous intensity all over again, only my bank balance would hold me back. To return to relive a time when the world lay ahead of me, everything seemed possible, and I was not old and cynical, now wouldn't that be marvellous? It is so refreshing to watch a movie that involves genuine acting, and Daniel Auteuil is magnificent, as always, his eyes alone capable of expressing so much emotion. And it sets 21st century and possibly futuristic technology against a backdrop of 1974, when life really was all so much simpler. The movie does at times become dream-like in its depiction of Victor's recreation of his youthful journey, and most certainly surreal, definitely bewildering in places for him, and the whole story is cleverly handled with wit and elegance. Well worth seeing, and I will give it a faultless 10/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13896,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2019-11-06","keywords":"husband wife relationship,husband wife conflict,dinner,actor,actress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3931160345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc4YzEzNTYtMzVkOC00NDlmLWI0ODItNTliODNlOWRmOGIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc4YzEzNTYtMzVkOC00NDlmLWI0ODItNTliODNlOWRmOGIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0133899/","name":"Guillaume Canet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3723133/","name":"Doria Tillier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267707/","name":"Nicolas Bedos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070074/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410559/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267707/","name":"Nicolas Bedos"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="
