programme.title: Step Up
Step Up
programme.desc: Step Up: Directed by Anne Fletcher. With Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan, Damaine Radcliff, De'Shawn Washington. Tyler Gage receives the opportunity of a lifetime after vandalizing a performing arts school, gaining him the chance to earn a scholarship and dance with an up and coming dancer, Nora." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0462590/","name":"Step Up","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODEzMzVhODgtOTc1NS00MmY3LWI3OGUtN2ZjNDEwM2ExZjJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Tyler Gage receives the opportunity of a lifetime after vandalizing a performing arts school, gaining him the chance to earn a scholarship and dance with an up and coming dancer, Nora.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0462590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"screenwriter-14"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"STEP UP to a magical film of dance, diversity, rhythm and blues","reviewBody":"What a wonderful surprise to find such a terrific film of dance and music in STEP UP and the actors/dancers were out of this world. Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan are magic on the screen and the music is sensational. My friend, Alia, from UCLA, had raved about this film and wanted me to see it, and I am so glad that I did. I found not only the music and dancing, but the story set in the jungle of a big city of young black men and a young white man struggling to survive and come up with fulfilling lives, to be a journey that is true to the lives of so many young men and women today in metropolitan cities in the USA.\n\nDuane Adler and Melissa Rosenberg have created a film in STEP UP that just hits your heart and soul with the character development created through the actors music and dance, and the sets and costumes which fit each character. I didn't want this film to end, but the last scene is just the one you wanted to see and feel. With STEP UP, you have a strong story, incredible music, wonderful young actors in a diverse world, and the hope that now their young lives can really begin. Loved this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114786,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2007-02-07","keywords":"title directed by female,dance school,dance movie,disney,community service","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Up","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1820374553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU1NzU5MjkwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODk5NDkxMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU1NzU5MjkwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODk5NDkxMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Step Up"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1564087/","name":"Jenna Dewan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1690482/","name":"Damaine Radcliff"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281945/","name":"Anne Fletcher"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163665/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012137/","name":"Duane Adler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0742279/","name":"Melissa Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Step Up 2: The Streets: Directed by Jon M. Chu. With Briana Evigan, Robert Hoffman, Adam Sevani, Cassie Ventura. Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1023481/","name":"Step Up 2: The Streets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0NzYxOTgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgxMjc1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1023481/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GibMart7"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dancing Makes The Movie","reviewBody":"I actually thought that the movie was pretty good. It's not as bad as the reviews that it's getting, just don't go in expecting to get an Oscar performance. The storyline was a little all over the place. Typical teen dance movie. BUT the dancing is amazing couldn't keep my eyes off the screen. Robert Hoffman did a decent job, he really lays the charm in throughout the whole movie. The dance scenes make the entire movie. Ethnically, it is such a diverse cast of people, there is someone for everyone to identify with. The soundtrack is insanely good also. By the end of it you will be quoting lines and wanting to dance for sure.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85707,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Music","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-06-04","keywords":"dance off,dancing in the rain,dance movie,dance audition,dance crew","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Up 2 the Streets","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1253179673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Step Up 2 the Streets Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1382207/","name":"Robert Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0263759/","name":"Briana Evigan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0144260/","name":"Cassie Ventura"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160840/","name":"Jon M. programme.title: Lindenberg! Mach dein Ding
Lindenberg! Mach dein Ding!
programme.desc: Lindenberg! Mach dein Ding: Directed by Hermine Huntgeburth. With Jan Bülow, Jesse Hansen, Julia Jentsch, Benjamin Friedhoff. The life story of music icon Udo Lindenberg who revolutionized the German music industry." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9181732/","name":"Lindenberg! Mach dein Ding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJkMTQ0YWYtNjFlOC00NjhmLWI0NGUtMzBiZTg1NDEwYWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzExMjg3MTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The life story of music icon Udo Lindenberg who revolutionized the German music industry.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9181732/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ecom-bkl"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice biopic - big hit in Germany","reviewBody":"Udo Lindenberg is one of Germanys greatest rockstars. He manages to be around since the early 70ies. Up to today he records and goes on tour, fillioing the biggest venues. This biopic about his childhood and first steps into his uniquecareer was made with a lot of dedication. The settings and stages are for real: Gronau in the 50ies, Hamburg St. Pauli in the early 70ies. Great music of course, we see Udo developing his own voice and style - indeed, he was the first german singer singing rock music in his own language, and being successfull. As a Lindenberg fan, you may appreciate the whole story. But to have a clever story, the script doesn't tell the whole story - a lot of career steps just were taken away, e.g. Udo had some really cool jobs as a jazz and rock drummer beside the jobs we see in the film. Big names in his career like Klaus Doldinger are not mentioned. The filmmakers are more into showing Udos private life - and later on towards the films end, they are just a bit too pretentious with showing Udo for 15 minutes as an alcohol drinking kind of guy - but whats the point in this? Maybe they better could have shown him recording his 1st hit album - but thats the way biopics go, you have to add some drama.... in the end this film will be very successfull in Germany, and even for foreign film lovers there is a lot to see and hear - and don't miss supporting role Detlev Buck as Mattheisen, the greasy slick Teldec A&R manager :-)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":586,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Biography","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-01-16","keywords":"f rated,biopic,male frontal nudity,male nudity,male rear nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2635317017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzk4MGE3YjQtOTYxOC00M2FjLThlNjUtNGY1N2ViYzM0YWJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzk4MGE3YjQtOTYxOC00M2FjLThlNjUtNGY1N2ViYzM0YWJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6060272/","name":"Jan Bülow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11175621/","name":"Jesse Hansen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421799/","name":"Julia Jentsch"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0403101/","name":"Hermine Huntgeburth"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073926/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0279815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749191/","name":"Alexander M. Rümelin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2846685/","name":"Christian Lyra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1361160/","name":"Sebastian Wehlings"}],"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Transplant
Transplant
Transplant
programme.desc:
Transplant: Created by Joseph Kay. With Laurence Leboeuf, Hamza Haq, Ayisha Issa, Jim Watson. An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"}}</script><metacontent="

A lone crimefighter battles the forces of evil with the help of a virtually indestructible and artificially intelligent supercar." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0083437/","name":"Knight Rider","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVjMmY2ZTctZWNjMS00MzQ1LTgzZjItN2ZmNzMwMmUxNDlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lone crimefighter battles the forces of evil with the help of a virtually indestructible and artificially intelligent supercar.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0083437/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lifemedlpn2002","dateCreated":"2005-11-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Knight Rider was a great show","reviewBody":"I've sat here and I've read a lot of comments from people about the TV show KnightRider and there are a several from people who talk down this show. My thought is you have to remember when the show was written okay it was written in the 1980s oh wow that should give yourself a clue to how the stories were written.... Now myself i grew up on TV shows like KnightRider, The ATeam, The Fall Guy and i loved to watch them every time they were on. some of you guys act like you have a car just like KITT in your very Driveway which even after all of the years that have gone by they still haven't came up with a car as close to that one portrayed on that TV show. some of you think that those stunts were simulated ha ha ha. iam sorry but what era are you from the 1999? back in the 70s and 80s CG was not yet thought about people they did real stunts with real cars some equipped with special roll bars and struts to protect the stuntman. Plus if you don't like the show don't watch it but you don't have to sit there and run it down. David Hasseloff was and is in my personal thought a very good actor. and for some of you who have written in here trying to pass yourself for someone from that era people really liked having big and outrages hairdos back then just like people like to have every part of there body's pierced from one end to the other today. it goes with fads okay if you think the 80s were bad tune into the 70s you haven't seen nothing yet okay. now that i have tried to put a few of the party poopers in there place i will go on and say that i love the KnighterRider series and it brings back a lot of fond memories for me for when i was a kid! i still watch them on TV or actually DVD now since i don't hardly catch them on TV anymore. Kitt and Michael were a great team their relationship was really great there are times i wish my car cared about me like KITT cared for Michael. especially in bad and inclement weather. And Really how many of you out there haven't ever gave your car a name now come on! you have no imagination what so ever! If you sit there and knock every great TV show that ever hit the airwaves. well thats all i have to say on the subject everyone out there take care!!!!!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32260,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1982-09-26","keywords":"vehicle driving by itself,private detective,crime fighter,pontiac trans am,1980s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0611811/","name":"Edward Mulhare","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000865/","name":"Richard Basehart"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088140/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488991/","name":"Glen A. programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0408381, Title: Doc Martin, --- Description: Doc Martin: Created by Dominic Minghella, Mark Crowdy, Craig Ferguson. With Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Ian McNeice, Joe Absolom. The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0408381/","name":"Doc Martin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNmMTAxZTAtNzNhZS00MThhLWJmMmEtYWExZGUzODkxMmM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408381/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"groggo","dateCreated":"2007-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Brits Know How to Do It","reviewBody":"Doc Martin is so unusual and wonderfully off-kilter that it becomes addictive within 20 minutes of exposure. 

The titular Doc is a guy who was probably a curmudgeon before puberty. He's a surgeon from sophisticated, worldly London who moves to (fictional) Portwenn on the coast of Cornwall because he suddenly becomes ill at the sight of blood. This is not a good omen for a surgeon. He quits to become a general practitioner and he's satisfied, thanks very much, with checkups, prescriptions and referrals.

The foul-mannered, blunt-spoken Doc smugly considers himself above the crowd, but he soon learns he is really BELOW the crowd, out of step with Portwenn's eccentricities, value systems and peculiar burghers, who make the mere lunatics of London look normal by comparison.

Martin Clunes is terrific in the lead role. He is a tall, charismatic and not exactly handsome actor who looks like he would be more comfortable playing cops and heavies. He is, instead, a consummate comic actor. His facial and physical comedy, his frequent bouts of exasperation and bewilderment, are things to behold. (Note: some wags have compared him to 'House,' from the popular TV drama of the same name. House is played by Hugh Laurie, another splendid Brit, and that's about where the comparison begins and ends. They are two very different characters in two very different shows.)

Portwenn's local population, with its twisted logic that somehow makes perfect sense, is represented through the tour-de-force acting of supporting players: Bert (Ian McNeice, who always dazzles playing offbeat, world-weary philosophical characters); Louise (the charming and beautiful Caroline Catz), who either loves Martin or wants to kill him; corn-rowed Elaine (lovely Lucy Punch) as the ditzy assistant with her own set of secretarial ethics; and Doc's Aunt Joan (the great Stephanie Cole, who has been delighting audiences since the 1960s).

Dominic Minghella, he of the Minghella mob of talented artists (brother Anthony directed 'The English Patient'), is the brains behind this brilliant controlled chaos.

Don't miss this program. TV shows that are both funny AND intelligent are the rarest of TV fare.

And a fast footnote: let us all bow our heads and pray that Hollywood doesn't try to remake this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14318,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-02","keywords":"socially awkward man,doctor,opposites attract,fear of blood,rural setting","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167340/","name":"Martin Clunes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146414/","name":"Caroline Catz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573862/","name":"Ian McNeice"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103911/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136637/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591286/","name":"Dominic Minghella","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189596/","name":"Mark Crowdy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272401/","name":"Craig Ferguson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Doc Martin: Series 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2606414105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Doc Martin: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

Transplant
programme.desc:
Transplant: Created by Joseph Kay. With Laurence Leboeuf, Hamza Haq, Ayisha Issa, Jim Watson. An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"}}</script><metacontent="

An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic","dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. IMDb data; ttnr: 10936342, Title: Transplant, --- Description: Transplant: Created by Joseph Kay. With Laurence Leboeuf, Hamza Haq, Ayisha Issa, Jim Watson. An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic","dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"</script><metacontent="

Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 10936342, Title: Transplant, --- Description: Transplant: Created by Joseph Kay. With Laurence Leboeuf, Hamza Haq, Ayisha Issa, Jim Watson. An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic","dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0408381, Title: Doc Martin, --- Description: Doc Martin: Created by Dominic Minghella, Mark Crowdy, Craig Ferguson. With Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Ian McNeice, Joe Absolom. The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0408381/","name":"Doc Martin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNmMTAxZTAtNzNhZS00MThhLWJmMmEtYWExZGUzODkxMmM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408381/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"groggo","dateCreated":"2007-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Brits Know How to Do It","reviewBody":"Doc Martin is so unusual and wonderfully off-kilter that it becomes addictive within 20 minutes of exposure. 

The titular Doc is a guy who was probably a curmudgeon before puberty. He's a surgeon from sophisticated, worldly London who moves to (fictional) Portwenn on the coast of Cornwall because he suddenly becomes ill at the sight of blood. This is not a good omen for a surgeon. He quits to become a general practitioner and he's satisfied, thanks very much, with checkups, prescriptions and referrals.

The foul-mannered, blunt-spoken Doc smugly considers himself above the crowd, but he soon learns he is really BELOW the crowd, out of step with Portwenn's eccentricities, value systems and peculiar burghers, who make the mere lunatics of London look normal by comparison.

Martin Clunes is terrific in the lead role. He is a tall, charismatic and not exactly handsome actor who looks like he would be more comfortable playing cops and heavies. He is, instead, a consummate comic actor. His facial and physical comedy, his frequent bouts of exasperation and bewilderment, are things to behold. (Note: some wags have compared him to 'House,' from the popular TV drama of the same name. House is played by Hugh Laurie, another splendid Brit, and that's about where the comparison begins and ends. They are two very different characters in two very different shows.)

Portwenn's local population, with its twisted logic that somehow makes perfect sense, is represented through the tour-de-force acting of supporting players: Bert (Ian McNeice, who always dazzles playing offbeat, world-weary philosophical characters); Louise (the charming and beautiful Caroline Catz), who either loves Martin or wants to kill him; corn-rowed Elaine (lovely Lucy Punch) as the ditzy assistant with her own set of secretarial ethics; and Doc's Aunt Joan (the great Stephanie Cole, who has been delighting audiences since the 1960s).

Dominic Minghella, he of the Minghella mob of talented artists (brother Anthony directed 'The English Patient'), is the brains behind this brilliant controlled chaos.

Don't miss this program. TV shows that are both funny AND intelligent are the rarest of TV fare.

And a fast footnote: let us all bow our heads and pray that Hollywood doesn't try to remake this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14318,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-02","keywords":"socially awkward man,doctor,opposites attract,fear of blood,rural setting","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167340/","name":"Martin Clunes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146414/","name":"Caroline Catz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573862/","name":"Ian McNeice"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103911/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136637/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591286/","name":"Dominic Minghella","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189596/","name":"Mark Crowdy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272401/","name":"Craig Ferguson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Doc Martin: Series 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2606414105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Doc Martin: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mariage à l'anglaise
programme.desc: Depuis qu’ils se sont rencontrés dans une soirée, Nat, jeune femme ambitieuse, et Josh, apprenti romancier, nagent dans le bonheur, malgré leurs différences. Car si Josh est plutôt du genre intellectuel, Nat est une fonceuse. Ce qui ne les a pas empêchés d’être réunis par un coup de foudre réciproque. Leur mariage est idyllique, même si personne de leurs proches à leurs amis, jusqu’au pasteur qui officie, ne croit qu’il pourra durer… Surtout quand l’ex-petite amie de Josh, Chloe, et le charmant client américain de Nat, Guy, s’en mêlent.
